While poisoned in this way, the creature takes 7 (2d6) poison damage at the start of its turn. A poisoned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc: The water leaper makes a bite attack against a medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, and has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the water leaper. A swallowed target takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of the water leaper's turn. The water leaper can have one creature swallowed at a time. If the water leaper dies, the swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can use 5 feet of movement to crawl, prone, out of the corpse.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The water leaper can breathe both air and water.

special_abilities.name: Camouflage
special_abilities.desc: The water leaper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

name: Weeping Treant
damage_resistances: bludgeoning and piercing

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The treant makes three slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special_abilities.name: Siege Monster
special_abilities.desc: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

special_abilities.name: Treespeech
special_abilities.desc: A weeping treant can converse with plants, and most plants greet them with a friendly or helpful attitude.

special_abilities.name: Acidic Tears
special_abilities.desc: Thick tears of dark sap stream continuously down the treant's face and trunk. These tears are highly acidic - anyone who attacks the treant from a range of 5 feet or less must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 6 (1d12) acid damage from splashed tears. This acidic matter continues doing 6 (1d12) acid damage at the start of each of the creature's turns until it or an adjacent ally uses an action to wipe off the tears or three rounds elapse.

name: Werebear
armor_desc: 10 in humanoid form, 11 (natural armor) in bear and hybrid form

speed.notes: 40 ft., climb 30 ft. in bear or hybrid form

damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: In bear form, the werebear makes two claw attacks. In humanoid form, it makes two greataxe attacks. In hybrid form, it can attack like a bear or a humanoid.

actions.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with were bear lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.desc: The werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid or into a Large bear, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it. is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The werebear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

name: Wereboar
armor_desc: 10 in humanoid form, 11 (natural armor) in boar or hybrid form
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wereboar makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its tusks.

actions.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.desc: The wereboar can use its action to polymorph into a boar-humanoid hybrid or into a boar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
special_abilities.desc: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special_abilities.desc: If the wereboar takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

name: Wererat
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
senses: darkvision 60 ft. (rat form only), passive Perception 12

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wererat makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

actions.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only).
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.desc: The wererat can use its action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The wererat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

name: Weretiger
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: In humanoid form, the weretiger makes two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can attack like a humanoid or make two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claw (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.desc: The weretiger can use its action to polymorph into a tiger-humanoid hybrid or into a tiger, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The weretiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

special_abilities.name: Pounce (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
special_abilities.desc: If the weretiger moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the weretiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

name: Werewolf
armor_desc: 11 in humanoid form, 12 (natural armor) in wolf or hybrid form
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The werewolf makes two attacks: two with its spear (humanoid form) or one with its bite and one with its claws (hybrid form).

actions.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

special_abilities.name: Shapechanger
special_abilities.desc: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 10). Until this grapple ends, the wharfling can't use its bite on another target. While the target is grappled, the wharfling's bite attack hits it automatically.

actions.name: Pilfer
actions.desc: A wharfling that has an opponent grappled at the start of its turn can make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check as a bonus action. The DC for this check equals 10 plus the grappled target's Dexterity modifier. If the check is successful, the wharfling steals some small metallic object from the target, and the theft is unnoticed if the same result equals or exceeds the target's passive Perception. A wharfling flees with its treasure.

name: Wharfling Swarm
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 21 (6d6) piercing damage, or 10 (3d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

actions.name: Locking Bite
actions.desc: When a creature leaves a wharfling swarm's space, 1d3 wharflings remain grappled to them (escape DC 10). Each wharfling inflicts 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage at the start of the creature's turns until it escapes from the grapples.

actions.name: Pilfer
actions.desc: A wharfling swarm makes 1d6 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks each round against every creature in the swarm's space. The DC for each check equals 10 plus the target creature's Dexterity modifier. For each successful check, the wharflings steal some small metallic object from the target, and the theft is unnoticed if the same result equals or exceeds the target's passive Perception.

special_abilities.name: Swarm
special_abilities.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a tiny wharfling. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ape makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or contract the arcane wasting disease (see sidebar).

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Frenzy (1/Day)
actions.desc: When two or more foes are adjacent to the ape, it can enter a deadly battle frenzy. Instead of using its normal multiattack, a frenzied white ape makes one bite attack and two claw attacks against each enemy within 5 feet of it. Melee attacks against the white ape are made with advantage from the end of that turn until the start of the white ape's next turn.

special_abilities.name: Hatred for Spellcasters
special_abilities.desc: The white ape does one extra die of damage (d8 or d10, respectively) per attack against an enemy it has seen cast a spell.

special_abilities.name: Arcane Wasting (Disease)
special_abilities.desc: When the bodily fluid of an infected creature touches a humanoid or when an infected creature casts a spell (direct or indirect) on a humanoid, that humanoid must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become infected with arcane wasting. Beginning 1d6 days after infection, the infected creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of each long rest. If the saving throw fails, the victim loses 1d3 Intelligence and 1d3 Wisdom. Lost Intelligence and Wisdom can't be recovered while the disease persists. If the saving throw succeeds, nothing happens; the disease ends after the second consecutive successful saving throws. Once the disease ends, lost Intelligence and Wisdom can be restored by greater restoration or comparable magic. The disease is also cured by lesser restoration if the caster makes a successful DC 15 spellcasting check.

name: Wight
damage_immunities: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

name: Will-o'-Wisp
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Shock
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

special_abilities.name: Consume Life
special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 ft. of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

special_abilities.name: Ephemeral
special_abilities.desc: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

special_abilities.name: Incorporeal Movement
special_abilities.desc: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

special_abilities.name: Variable Illumination
special_abilities.desc: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The wolf exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

special_abilities.name: Snow Camouflage
special_abilities.desc: The wolf has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

name: Witchlight
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands the language of its creator but can't speak

actions.name: Light Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Flash (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The witchlight emits a bright burst of light that blinds all sighted creatures within 30 feet for 1d4 rounds unless they succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw.

special_abilities.name: Dispel Magic Weakness
special_abilities.desc: Casting dispel magic on a witchlight paralyzes it for 1d10 rounds.

special_abilities.name: Luminance
special_abilities.desc: A witchlight normally glows as brightly as a torch. The creature can dim itself to the luminosity of a candle, but it cannot extinguish its light. Because of its glow, the witchlight has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

special_abilities.name: Thin As Light
special_abilities.desc: While a witchlight is not incorporeal, it can pass through any opening that light can.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf makes two melee or ranged attacks.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

special_abilities.name: Danger Sense
special_abilities.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on Dexterity saving throws against attacks it can see when it is not blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

special_abilities.name: Dwarven Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on attacks if at least one of the dwarf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

special_abilities.name: Reckless
special_abilities.desc: At the start of its turn, the wolf reaver dwarf can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
special_abilities.desc: The worg has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

name: Wormhearted Suffragan
damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wormhearted suffragan can make two helminth infestation attacks, or it can cast one spell and make one helminth infestation attack.

actions.name: Helminth Infestation
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with a helminth infestation (parasitic worms). An afflicted creature can't regain hit points and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the affliction reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the victim dies. The affliction lasts until removed by any magic that cures disease.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
the wormhearted suffragan's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

at will: command, detect evil and good

4/day: inflict wounds

2/day each: blindness-deafness, hold person

1/day each: animate dead, speak with dead

name: Wraith
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Create Specter
actions.desc: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

special_abilities.name: Incorporeal Movement
special_abilities.desc: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

name: Wyrmling Wind Dragon
senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath of Gales (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a blast of wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a successful DC 12 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the dragon and knocked prone. Unprotected flames in the cone are extinguished, and sheltered flames (such as those in lanterns) have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wyvern makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Xanka
languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't

actions.name: Absorb
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) force damage, and the xanka regains hit points equal to the damage caused by its attack. In addition, a living creature hit by this attack must make a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or suffer a gaping wound that causes 2 (1d4) necrotic damage at the end of each of the creature's turns until the wound is treated with magical healing or with a successful DC 10 Intelligence (Medicine) check. If a creature who fails this saving throw is wearing armor or using a shield, the creature can choose to prevent the necrotic damage by permanently reducing the AC of its armor or shield by 1 instead.

special_abilities.name: Ingest Weapons
special_abilities.desc: When the xanka is hit by a melee weapon and the final, adjusted attack roll is 19 or less, the weapon gains a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls, after inflicting damage for this attack. If the penalty reaches -5, the weapon is destroyed. Even magic weapons are subject to this effect.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The xanka's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Constructed Nature
special_abilities.desc: A xanka doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

name: Xhkarsh
senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 120 ft., passive Perception 16

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The xhkarsh makes two claw attacks and two stinger attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or have its fate corrupted. A creature with corrupted fate has disadvantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws, and it is immune to divination spells and to effects that sense emotions or read thoughts. The target's fate can be restored by a dispel evil and good spell or comparable magic.

actions.name: Seize Strand
actions.desc: The xhkarsh targets one creature within 5 feet of it whose fate has been corrupted. The target creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or a portion of the xhkarsh's consciousness inhabits its body. The target retains control of its body, but the xhkarsh can control its actions for 1 minute each day and can modify its memories as a bonus action (as if using the modify memory spell, DC 15). The target is unaware of the xhkarsh's presence, but can make a DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check once every 24 hours to notice the presence of the xhkarsh. This effect lasts until the xhkarsh ends it or the target's fate is restored by a dispel evil and good spell or comparable magic. A creature becomes immune to this effect for 24 hours when it succeeds on the saving throw to resist the effect or after the effect ends on it for any reason. A single xhkarsh can seize up to four strands at the same time.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The xhkarsh turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends. Equipment the xhkarsh wears or carries becomes invisible with it.

special_abilities.name: Treasure Sense

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Destroying Bellow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The ychen bannog delivers a fearsome bellow that can be heard up to ten miles away. Structures and unattended objects in a 60-foot cone take 55 (10d10) thunder damage. Creatures in the cone take 27 (5d10) thunder damage and are deafened for 1 hour, or take half damage and aren't deafened with a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw.

special_abilities.name: Ever-Sharp Horns
special_abilities.desc: The ychen bannog deals triple damage dice when it scores a critical hit with a gore attack.

special_abilities.name: Overrun
special_abilities.desc: When the ychen bannog takes the Dash action, it can move through the space of a Large or smaller creature, treating the creature's space as difficult terrain. As it moves through the creature's space, the ychen bannog can make a stomp attack as a bonus action.

special_abilities.name: Peaceful Creature
special_abilities.desc: The ychen bannog abhors combat and flees from it if possible. If unable to flee, the ychen bannog can attack a foe or obstacle to clear a path to safety. As an action, a driver or handler mounted on the ychen bannog or adjacent to it can make a DC 16 Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. On a success, the ychen bannog moves and attacks as directed by the driver. On a failure, the beast flees. The driver or handler must have proficiency in Animal Handling to attempt this check.

The creature cannot enter a space adjacent to the dragon unless it makes a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature can keep moving but only into spaces that aren't within 5 feet of the dragon and takes 4 (1d8) piercing damage from spikes.

special_abilities.desc: The cave dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot wide, 5-foot high tunnel in its wake.

3/day: darkness

**Slowing Breath.** The dragon exhales gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

Up to three Medium or one Large creatures can ride the spinosaurus. This trait disappears if the spinosaurus spends a month away from any reptilian humanoid.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Falling damage in the area increases to 1d10 per 10 feet fallen
actions.desc: When a creature starts its turn within the area or enters it for the first time in a turn, including when the dragon creates the field, it must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the creature is restrained. On a success the creature's speed is halved as long as it remains in the field. A restrained creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn. The field persists until the dragon's breath recharges, and it can't use gravitic breath twice consecutively.

actions.name: Stellar Flare Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales star fire in a 30- foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage and 28 (8d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the attack misses because of this increase the dragon can choose a creature within 30 feet to become the new target for that attack. Use the original attack roll to determine if the attack hits the new target.

special_abilities.name: Chill of the Void

Unprotected flames in the cone are extinguished, and sheltered flames (such as those in lanterns) have a 75 percent chance of being extinguished.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
the dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spell, requiring no material components:

special_abilities.name: Fog Vision
special_abilities.desc: The dragon sees normally through light or heavy obscurement caused by fog, mist, clouds, or high wind.

special_abilities.name: Uncontrollable
special_abilities.desc: The dragon's movement is never impeded by difficult terrain, and its speed can't be reduced by spells or magical effects. It can't be restrained (per the condition), and it escapes automatically from any nonmagical restraints (such as chains, entanglement, or grappling) by spending 5 feet of movement. Being underwater imposes no penalty on its movement or attacks.

name: Zaratan
damage_resistances: fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zaratan makes one bite attack and two flipper attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d10 + 10) piercing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and the zaratan can't bite another target.

actions.name: Flipper
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 26 Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the zaratan.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc: The zaratan makes one bite attack against a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes 26 (3d10 + 10) piercing damage, is swallowed, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, but has total cover against attacks and effects outside the zaratan. A swallowed creature takes 28 (8d6) acid damage at the start of each of the zaratan's turns. The zaratan can have any number of creatures swallowed at once. If the zaratan takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the zaratan must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the zaratan. If the zaratan dies, swallowed creatures are no longer restrained and can escape by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_desc: The zaratan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The zaratan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan moves up to half its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Swipe
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one flipper attack.

legendary_actions.name: Consume (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one bite attack or uses Swallow.

special_abilities.name: Fortified Shell
special_abilities.desc: The zaratan ignores any attack against its shell that doesn't do 30 points of damage or more. Attacking the zaratan's head or flippers bypasses this trait.

special_abilities.name: Endless Breath
special_abilities.desc: The zaratan breathes air, but it can hold its breath for years.

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.desc: While the zaratan remains motionless on the surface of the ocean (except for drifting) it is indistinguishable from a small island.

special_abilities.name: Siege Monster
special_abilities.desc: The zaratan does double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zimwi makes one claws attack and one bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the zimwi, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the zimwi, and it takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the zimwi's turns. If the zimwi's stomach takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the zimwi must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 5 feet of the zimwi. Damage done to a zimwi's stomach does not harm the zimwi. The zimwi's stomach is larger on the inside than the outside. It can have two Medium creatures or four Small or smaller creatures swallowed at one time. If the zimwi dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the zimwi isn't already grappling a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 11).

Creatures in a cone take 16 (3d10) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. If cones overlap, their damage adds together but each target makes only one saving throw. A zmey can choose whether this attack harms plants or plant creatures.

legendary_desc: The zmey can take 1 legendary action per head, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The zmey regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Bite
legendary_actions.desc: The zmey makes a bite attack.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The zmey makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Trample
legendary_actions.desc: The zmey moves up to half its land speed. It can enter enemy-occupied spaces but can't end its move there. Creatures in spaces the zmey enters must make successful DC 14 Dexterity saving throws or take 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The zmey can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Lake Leap
special_abilities.desc: A zmey spends much of its time lurking in lakes and ponds. When submerged in a natural pool of standing water, it can transport itself as a bonus action to a similar body of water within 5,000 feet. Rapidly flowing water doesn't serve for this ability, but the zmey can leap to or from a river or stream where the water is calm and slow-moving.

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
special_abilities.desc: If the zmey fails a saving throw, it can count it as a success instead.

special_abilities.name: Multiheaded
special_abilities.desc: The zmey normally has three heads. While it has more than one head, the zmey has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and stunned. If the zmey takes 40 or more damage in a single turn (and the damage isn't poison or psychic), one of its heads is severed. If all three of its heads are severed, the zmey dies.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The zmey regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zmey takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zmey's next turn. Regeneration stops functioning when all heads are severed. It takes 24 hours for a zmey to regrow a functional head.

special_abilities.name: Spawn Headling
special_abilities.desc: The severed head of a zmey grows into a zmey headling 2d6 rounds after being separated from the body. Smearing at least a pound of salt on the severed head's stump prevents this transformation.

name: Zmey Headling
damage_resistances: cold, fire

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zmey headline makes one bite attack and one claws attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The zmey headling exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area takes 16 (3d10) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The zmey headling can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The zmey headling reaver regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. This trait doesn't function if the zmey headling took acid or fire damage since the end of its previous turn. It dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

name: Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

special_abilities.name: Undead Fortitude
special_abilities.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.
